column4: Proud to join @RepFinkenauer in honoring rural hospitals and their hardworking providers and staff! They are more important than ever! https://t.co/EcnBVa6SNI

Did you know that, according to @MentalHealthAm, 1 in 5 US adults experience mental health issues each year? It’s time to #EndTheStigma and speak up for affordable mental health care and treatment. #WorldMentalHealthDay https://t.co/E8X2Y5ShM0

I’m honored to have been named a 2020 Champion of Science by the @scicoalition! Thank you @uiowa for nominating me! I’m proud to support the research being done at universities across the nation that is important to advancing health, safety and economic growth in our communities. https://t.co/uiC90PHs4G
Sad to hear the President and First Lady have contracted Covid. I wish them a fast and full recovery.

#2020Census data is critical to helping our communities thrive. It helps us obtain the healthcare, transportation, schools, affordable housing, and higher education that our families need to get a good start & succeed. Complete yours at https://t.co/WMZ9eCDVye  #BeCounted

You are not alone. If you or a loved one is struggling with a mental health or substance use disorder, know that recovery is possible. Find the resources you need:
https://t.co/MBl5Q8hVmA #RecoveryMonth #endthestigma https://t.co/WNS33RYvwL

As we mark the anniversary of 9/11, we remember the thousands who lost their lives. We also continue to honor the heroic actions of first responders who bravely risked and in many cases gave their own lives. We also pay tribute to the selfless service of our armed forces #911Day

As COVID continues to spread among Iowans, it is imperative that the Governor requires universal wearing of masks. Scientists and doctors, including Dr. Fauci, say masks help slow and stop it’s transmission.  https://t.co/FBTDB5bfO9

My condolences to the loved ones of Mel Stahmer who recently passed away from COVID-19. Mel was a retired letter carrier from Coralville who loved his job and took time to mentor many of the younger postal workers. My thoughts are with his family. https://t.co/L7ZHCVMklk

I wear a mask because my daughter's a nurse and I want her to stay healthy to be able to help others who are in need. But #WhyDoYouMask? For your mom? Your grandpa? Your neighbor? Click the link, upload a photo of yourself & tell me why you wear a mask! https://t.co/DlXRU2VHrw

In interviews and on a call with the nation's Governors, Dr. Deborah Birx urged Iowa to increase #COVID19 mitigation efforts. It is time for Iowa to follow the advice of medical experts and require mask usage when in public. https://t.co/7n9iZwNGVb

COVID-19 has devastated the child care sector, forcing closures and exacerbating the shortage of quality, affordable care. I’m proud to vote for the Child Care is Essential Act. This bill keeps child care affordable for working families. #SaveChildCare https://t.co/Jec4JOTd2z
We are all in this together. By everyone wearing a mask when out in public, we can come together to stop the spread and save lives. #Covid19 #MaskUp https://t.co/e3Fur1wSyM https://t.co/i8ha37jvzw

Reports say, on May 5, @IAPublicHealth stated 221 workers had been infected, when they had been informed the actual number was 522. Iowans deserve access to the truth about the presence of this virus in their communities and their places of work.

In a letter to @IAGovernor, I called on her administration to provide answers regarding why they initially reported the inaccurate number of employees at the Tyson plant who had contracted #COVID19. https://t.co/t06h0NxdVs

Joined with @repbenraylujan and others to introduce legislation to help address the growing problems with #COVID19 scams. We must keep consumers safe and punish those who are trying to use this situation to take advantage of others. https://t.co/Q3PPYsNWVM

Iowans know firsthand that service has the power to strengthen our communities in times of need. This pandemic is no different. Now is the time to expand programs like @AmeriCorps so they can further strengthen our response and recovery amid COVID-19. #Stand4Service https://t.co/AgGdYXv99u

#COVID19 has blown wide-open one of the nation’s worst kept secrets: the inequity with which students are not able to access the internet at home, known as the #homeworkgap. https://t.co/YmTmcFwMdH https://t.co/gXiiAtlSaM

There is still time for you to be counted! If you haven't already, visit https://t.co/B3G8G9ZThf to make sure Iowa gets the resources it needs for schools, hospitals and road repairs! #Census2020 https://t.co/rXwNbfYcbZ
ATTENTION IOWA FARMERS: you have until Aug 28 to apply for assistance if your operations were directly impacted by COVID-19. Details are in the link below. 🔽🔽 https://t.co/X1bciPASmt

IOWA SMALL BUSINESS OWNERS: The deadline to apply for SBA COVID-19 relief is JUNE 30. If you have questions about the PPP or EIDL programs, @SBA_Iowa is hosting a free webinar tomorrow, Thursday, June 18, at 1pm CDT to answer your questions! More Info: https://t.co/oz9Llxvjr4

Even in the midst of Coronavirus, it’s important to fill out the #2020Census! The census helps determine funding for schools, hospitals and infrastructure repair in local communities. Visit https://t.co/WMZ9eCDVye to help shape Iowa’s future! #WhyCensusMatters https://t.co/rXwNbfYcbZ
Here are some good tools to help keep those working in the Ag industry safe during the COVID pandemic. Thanks @GPCAH for all of your work! https://t.co/gWDvTzxUVT

Joined with @RepFinkenauer and House Biofuels Caucus to lead a call on Pres Trump to deny general waiver requests to 2020 RFS. The waivers would be another blow to the already hurting #biofuels industry. COVID has already hurt rural communities & we can’t add more pain. https://t.co/JGMVZRRxSl

As the number of deaths due to #COVID reaches a somber milestone, we’re reminded that each one of these 100k leaves behind family & friends who are mourning the loss of their loved ones. These people are more than a number. Now we must keep working & take action to reduce spread

ATTN IOWA FARMERS: If your operations were directly impacted by the #COVID pandemic, you can now apply for the @USDA's CFAP program. Applications are now available and sign up goes through August 28. Click the link below for more information! https://t.co/KxmlshO5f2

Even though #MemorialDay weekend will be celebrated differently this year, in this unprecedented time, it’s crucial that we recognize those who demonstrated the highest form of selflessness by sacrificing their lives for our nation. I hope everyone has a safe & healthy weekend! https://t.co/iWxxMW7EXR

In light of #COVID, the #motorcoach industry is facing a crisis like they’ve never seen before. We owe it to folks at @BurlTrailways, @CITSignature and @WindstarLines, among others, to ensure they have the backing of the fed gov and get the assistance they need to survive. https://t.co/Nh3QzC1Ese
Join me on Facebook at 11am this morning (5/20) for a forum on COVID-19. Have questions in advance, please reply to this tweet! https://t.co/P1TiovCbZI
Join me LIVE tomorrow (May 20) on Facebook for a forum on resources available to help combat COVID-19. If you have a question, reply to this tweet and let us know! https://t.co/7KHic0q06E

May is #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth, which is very important to me. Growing up, my mom struggled with mental health issues, so I've seen firsthand the need for timely care. Especially during trying times, we cannot let those with mental health issues be left behind. It's #Time2Act

Iowans have seen firsthand the benefits of @AmeriCorps after the floods. Now, many Americans are ready to roll up their sleeves and get to work helping our communities recover. I support the plan in Congress to expand national service to respond to #COVID19. #Stand4Service https://t.co/GwUIcrIlMQ

3- Increase testing capacity so we can move towards reopening our economy safely
4- More focus on unemployment flexibility for Iowans 
5- Reliable access to food for the people who have lost their paychecks, and urging the President to expand programs like SNAP

Our nation’s nurses continually show us what true dedication, compassion and hard work really mean! This #NationalNursesDay, we must honor our health care professionals by making sure they have the resources they need to save lives. #ThankYouNurses #TheRealHeroes https://t.co/fVfOM9weFx

Joined @WhipClyburn, @FrankPallone, @USRepMikeDoyle & others to announce a plan to ensure all Americans have  broadband access. It's unacceptable that rural small businesses, farmers, educators & healthcare workers don’t have the access needed to thrive!  
https://t.co/kyMJK260Y2

Strengthening health systems around the world gives every child a @ShotAtLife and protects America’s health security. This #WorldImmunizationWeek, we proudly stand with the health workers & vaccinators who dedicate their lives to protecting children from infectious diseases.
(2/2) ...plants are clean, workers are healthy & able to remain safe in order to keep the plants running and feeding America. https://t.co/kCETQ5eXri
We must protect our health care workers, first responders, and other essential workers who are on the frontlines of the fight against #COVID19. #WorkersMemorialDay https://t.co/Omy37K0Ayb

1/2: I have serious reservations regarding Gov Reynolds' decision to keep processing plants open at this time. The fact that hundreds of workers in these facilities tested positive for #COVID19 is worrisome not only for them, but also their families & communities where they live.

Dave gives an update on what he is working on and encourages folks to stick with the social distancing guidelines in order to keep everyone healthy and safe. Check out the video! https://t.co/4CvTw1fhwP

- More disaster loans
-Support for rural and underserved communities
-Access to SBA programs for farmers
 
Any #COVID19 relief bill must include these fixes if we want to help small businesses weather this crisis. #SmallBizRelief https://t.co/kByKeK1D4k

Pleased that the @USDA has released their COVID-19 Federal Rural Resource Guide. This will help get info to our farmers and those living in rural communities. Check out the link below for more info! https://t.co/K1CWeA33so

Thanks to Muscatine’s own HNI for stepping up to produce the personal protective equipment that our healthcare workers greatly need! Even in time like these, Iowans are pitching in to help their neighbors! https://t.co/FterRXXT02

If you do NOT file taxes each year, the IRS and @FreeFileTaxes have launched a tool for non-filers to register for their COVID-19 Economic Impact Payment. This allows folks to submit their information without having to fill a new return. More info 🔽🔽 https://t.co/8Q5vxyGIKr

Thanks to the hardworking Iowans, along with our friends in Illinois, who work for @JohnDeere! They are producing protective face shields to help keep our healthcare workers safe. Great to see folks stepping up to help others in this time of need.
https://t.co/6kahIx6j8q

Thanks to Oskaloosa's own, Interpower (@cordset), for taking on the COVID-19 fight by helping produce the cords needed to power ventilators. Iowan's are some of the most giving folks and I am proud they are stepping up to help in this time of need. https://t.co/kqv7So5StH

Today is #WorldHealthDay!
 
Let’s join together to celebrate the hard work of healthcare providers by showing our appreciation for their bravery, courage & resolve during the #COVID19 response. https://t.co/RDC9lT9aFl
Check out the #COVID19 Information Guide my office has compiled. It has links to various federal and state government websites to help you get the info you need!  https://t.co/IDisSK2clG

https://t.co/0ZQez2sEga

During these times, it is important to not only take care of your physical health, but also your mental health. Check out the links below for info on helping folks cope, dealing with additional stress and fighting social isolation. @CDCgov @AARP @samhsagov

Thanks to the students and faculty at @IowaStateU for working to help keep our first responders and those on the frontline, safe. Using 3D printers, they are making face masks for Iowa hospitals. https://t.co/HyZr88Wxmv

International Travelers: the US @StateDept issued an updated Level 4 Global Health Advisory. Individuals who want to return to the US should seek to do so now! Prospects for commercial or evacuation flights could become more limited or unavailable. https://t.co/xHSB8kCvdK

The @USDA has additional information on their website about dealing with food insecurity during the COVID pandemic. Check them out below.
https://t.co/Exa6vXENh1

For folks in Johnson County who are in need of food assistance, below is a list of locations you can receive help. Many other counties and school districts in Iowa are offering food assistance during this time as well. You can contact them directly. #COVID19 https://t.co/l3mXWkPZV6

Due to the passage of the third bill to combat #COVID19, the CARES Act, @iowaworkforce released new guidelines for unemployment insurance. If you need more info, take a look below and see how these new rules may affect you. https://t.co/ZwHGeF97Xd

Very sad to hear of the first death due to #COVID19 in Iowa's Second District. Terry and I send our condolences to their family and loved ones and to those of everyone who has been affected by this illness.
For all the latest information on #COVID19, including steps to tackle the virus and resources for coping, check out the @UIowaCPH website! 🔽🔽 https://t.co/9BF3TE1nL3

Very pleased that @IowaStateU and @uiowa have come together in this time of need to help speed up #COVID2019 testing across Iowa. This collaboration will expedite testing in order for Iowans to get their results faster! https://t.co/6355WNSiOB

Community health centers play an integral part in Iowa’s healthcare system, which is why I am pleased that local CHCs in Iowa's Second District received funding to help combat the #COVID19 illness & keep Iowans healthy and safe. https://t.co/Vn4QRjNypj
If you’re an Iowa small business and have questions about disaster assistance and the impact of the #COVID19 virus, join @SBA_Iowa TODAY for a free webinar. Details 🔽🔽 https://t.co/AlUo967NhL

There are concerns from across the district about PPE shortages. Congress & the President must act now to address this shortage. Our healthcare workers should not be worried about supply shortages as they work overtime to keep us healthy and safe. https://t.co/zcZ1qciR0t

Even though you may not be showing symptoms, you could still be a carrier of #COVID19 & pass it along to others without knowing. It’s important to practice these CDC recommendations to help slow the spread and keep yourself and others safe and healthy https://t.co/3LmkuWIfVv

Healthcare workers are on the frontlines in the fight against #coronavirus! We must make sure they have the supplies they need to properly treat and care for those who become sick, as well as to protect themselves. https://t.co/8DYLmHpomH

Even though you may not be showing symptoms, you could still be a carrier of COVID-19 & pass it along to others without knowing. It’s important that everyone helps out in times like these and that means staying home and avoiding gatherings where it could be passed unknowingly. https://t.co/KKg8kldCya

Due to public safety and to help slow the spread of COVID-19, my physical offices in Iowa City, Davenport and DC will close 3/17/2020. Iowans will be able to reach our office between 8:30am-6:00pm CT. Emails will monitored on a regular basis. More info: https://t.co/rl2MTo4skn

For the latest information and facts about the coronavirus, I encourage everyone to visit the CDC's website. They have the most up to date information and ways to help prevent its spread. Check them out in the link below! https://t.co/eKmRlRUAcT

Below is my statement on the recent positive testing of 3 Iowans for #COVID2019. For more information visit https://t.co/Q9nAgwQHCa.  In addition, a public hotline has been established for Iowans with questions about COVID-19. The line is available 24/7 by calling: 2-1-1. https://t.co/FBqeVKLiQF

Neglected tropical disease affect 1 in 6 people worldwide. America is leading the fight to #BeatNTDs by supporting vital research and treatment programs at @USAID, @NIH, @CDCgov, and the @DeptofDefense. This #WorldNTDDay, let’s recommit to the fight. https://t.co/fP0mSMHRen

Today marks the 47th anniversary of #RoevWade, which affirms women are able to make their own healthcare decisions. I will continue to fight to ensure these rights are defended and abortions remain safe and legal. #ProtectRoe

Proud to join @RepFinkenauer in honoring National Rural Health Day, today, Nov 21st! She led a resolution to emphasize the importance of rural America and recognize the efforts and contributions made to address the unique challenges in rural health care. https://t.co/yogl2kHJ6h

If you or someone you know gets their health insurance through the Affordable Care Act exchanges, you have until 12/15 to make changes to the plan you have or sign up for coverage if you don’t have it currently. Visit https://t.co/A1ptpTuS5d for all the details. https://t.co/HKyvT4hFsM

Big win for Community Health Centers in the House @EnergyCommerce Committee! Proud that we passed a bipartisan, 4 year reauthorization for CHCs across the nation. This bill will provide $4 billion per year to help low-income folks get the healthcare they need and deserve.
